metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2516 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NTP before 4.2.8p7 and 4.3.x before 4.3.92, when mode7 is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (ntpd abort) by using the same IP address multiple times in an unconfig directive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10').
